available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: American-Style India Pale Ale
style.description: American-style India pale ales are perceived to have medium-high to intense hop bitterness, flavor and aroma with medium-high alcohol content. The style is further characterized by floral, fruity, citrus-like, piney, resinous, or sulfur-like American-variety hop character. Note that one or more of these American-variety hop characters is the perceived end, but the hop characters may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. The use of water with high mineral content results in a crisp, dry beer. This pale gold to deep copper-colored ale has a full, flowery hop aroma and may have a strong hop flavor (in addition to the perception of hop bitterness). India pale ales possess medium maltiness which contributes to a medium body. Fruity-ester flavors and aromas are moderate to very strong. Diacetyl can be absent or may be perceived at very low levels. Chill and/or hop haze is allowable at cold temperatures. (English and citrus-like American hops are considered enough of a distinction justifying separate American-style IPA and English-style IPA categories or subcategories. Hops of other origins may be used for bitterness or approximating traditional American or English character. See English-style India Pale Ale

data.name: IPA
data.description: This IPA is designed to have a domino effect on your palate. Everything you want in an IPA gracefully falls in place as the English caramel malts provide a superb malt backbone. From first sip to last your palate will be taken over by resinous, piney, herbal and citrusy hop notes as the Magnum, nugget, Chinook, cascade and first gold hops all come together to convert any level of craft lover into a fan of this one.

data.name: IPA
data.description: Ours is a bona fide West Coast American IPA.  Lots of citrus, pine and stone fruit hop character to match the complexity of the grains.  Light copper in color and well balanced.

data.name: IPA
data.description: An American IPA for IPA drinkers. Full of flavor with the bitterness to back it up. Centennial, Citra and El Dorado hops.

data.name: IPA
data.description:
Ours is a traditional IPA, using traditional aroma-filled hops, instead of the very bitter but less aromatic hops common among Americal IPAs. This is a very bitter beer, with a sizeable hop aroma and dry finish. The overall impression is of a hoppy, medium-bodied beer.
Our bestselling ale, it has remained on tap since the day we opened.

data.name: IPA
data.description: An experimental IPA brewed with pale malt and wheat. It's heavily hopped with Simcoe and mango is added late in the boil to enhance the hop fruitiness.

style.name: Experimental Beer (Lager or Ale)
style.description: An experimental beer is any beer (lager, ale or other) that is primarily grain-based and employs unusual techniques and/or ingredients. A minimum 51% of the fermentable carbohydrates must be derived from malted grains. The overall uniqueness of the process, ingredients used and creativity should be considered. Beers such as garden (vegetable), fruit, chocolate, coffee, spice, specialty or other beers that match existing categories should not be entered into this category. Beers not easily matched to existing style categories in a competition would often be entered into this category. Beers that are a combination of other categories (spice, smoke, specialty, porter, etc.) could also be entered into this category. A statement by the brewer explaining the experimental or other nature of the beer is essential in order for fair assessment in competitions. Generally, a 25-word statement would suffice in explaining the experimental nature of the beer.

data.name: IPA
data.description: JBC India Pale Ale, golden color, medium malt sweetness, three hop addition plus dry hopped. Bitter finish.

data.name: IPA
data.description: A Colorado IPA if there ever was one, with a strong malt backbone that balances a bold, clean hop presence from New World varieties. This approachable ale is pale in color and an easy-drinking.

data.name: IPA
data.description:
This unique India Pale Ale features our favorite hops—Simcoe®, Amarillo® and Nugget. A generous Amarillo and Simcoe dry hop provide for an assertive, hop-forward nose and front palate. We don’t use traditional bittering hops in our IPA, providing nothing but stimulating citrus and floral characteristics.

Inspired by a recipe from our good friend and fellow homebrewer Tim from the North Shore Homebrewers Club.

data.name: IPA
data.description: Moving up the hop-chain from our Pale Ale, this insanely hopped beer features copious amounts of columbus and cascade hops. Floral, Piney, Citrusy – it’s all there and more making a hop head’s delight.

data.name: IPA
data.description: Do you like spicy food?  Do you like citrus?  Do you like a beer with a punch?  If so, this is your beer.  This beer is traditionally dry hopped (stored with fresh hops) to preserve the beer for later dilution.  It was first shipped by the English around Africa and through the Indian Ocean to troops in India.  Beer geeks have since developed it into a nice high strength beer with explosive hop content.  Ours is bold, strong, and balanced with a heavy hop backbone.

data.name: IPA
data.description: IPA’s are always about the hops, and this fine traditional ale is no exception. It is brewed with an interesting and continuous blending of four Pacific Northwest hop varieties. These exciting hops are backed up by rich malt flavours that produce a complex character and lingering hop finish. Although this beer has fierce hop, it will surprise with its gentle bite.

data.name: IPA
data.description: Here’s one for the hop heads.  Our IPA (India Pale Ale) is all about the hops.  We use more than 18 pounds of hops per batch.  Look for a big hoppy nose of citrus, grapefruit and floral notes that comes from dry hopping with a variety of American hops.  The flavor is of course hop driven but has a smooth malt backbone to keep things balanced.  The body is light with a crisp, minerally finish that allows the bitterness to linger.  This is the beer that will kick your mouth in the face.  The carbonation and bitterness really help this beer to lift heavy foods off of the palate so try this with big flavors as it stands up to the best of them.

This pale gold to deep copper-colored ale has a full, flowery hop aroma and may have a strong hop flavor (in addition to the perception of hop bitterness). India pale ales possess medium maltiness which contributes to a medium body. Fruity-ester flavors and aromas are moderate to very strong. Diacetyl can be absent or may be perceived at very low levels. Chill and/or hop haze is allowable at cold temperatures. (English and citrus-like American hops are considered enough of a distinction justifying separate American-style IPA and English-style IPA categories or subcategories. Hops of other origins may be used for bitterness or approximating traditional American or English character. See English-style India Pale Ale

data.name: IPA
data.description: A base of pale, Munich, and Carapils malts is just enough to contain the massive hop flavor and aroma packed into this highly drinkable IPA. A blend of four American hop varieties is added four times in the kettle and twice in the fermentor for a complex and layered hop experience. Best served at 45-50˚F in a tulip or English style pint glass.

data.name: IPA
data.description: A copper color and assertive hop bitterness characterize this pale ale.  Our IPA brings together both American and British influences. The hop emphasis in this IPA is more in the aroma and flavor without being too bitter.

data.description: A more subtle hop variety with hints of floral and citrus make this a pleasant session beer

data.name: IPA
data.description: An American style India Pale Ale. Light amber in color with a big citrus hop aroma. A decidedly hoppy and bitter, and moderately strong ale, this beer is for the hop lover. The malt flavor is just enough to balance out the Citrus, Grapefruit and Pine flavors from the hops. Medium bodied with a crisp dry finish. Brewed with 2-Row Malt, Munich Malt, Caramel Malt, Victory Malt, and Honey Malt. Hops are Summit, Simcoe, Cascade and Willamette. Dry hopping the beer with Cascade and Chinook hops when it is finished with fermentation gives it its big hop aroma. Year Round Flagship. IPA contains 6.3% ABV.

data.name: IPA
data.description:
Authentic India Pale Ale
Wild Rose IPA (India Pale Ale) is a beautiful copper- coloured ale, rich in caramel malt character and well balanced with plenty of hops.

An authentic India Pale Ale, this IPA is handcrafted for the true ale drinker.

data.name: IPA
data.description: Our IPA is a modern take on the West Coast original. We add the majority of the hops late in the brewing process resulting in a huge hop aroma of citrus fruits balanced with herbs and pine. Flaked wheat and Optic malt add some complexity and body, but this beer is all about hop aroma and bitterness.

data.name: IPA
data.description: If you thought an IPA was too hoppy for you, you’ll be in for a surprise.  Our India Pale Ale has big pine, citrus & stone fruit aromas but a clean, dry finish that will change your mind on IPA’s.

data.name: IPA
data.description: Inspired by New England IPAs, this brew imparts juicy hints of mango, peach, pear and citrus aroma, with a silky oat finish. We used a healthy dose of spelt and oats and dry hopped with copious amounts of Mosaic, Ekuanot and other exotic hop varieties.

data.name: IPA
data.description: Our Flagship IPA is fresh, full flavored natural ale based on the American version of this classic style. Locally grown and malted grain is combined with CaraPils, Crystal 60L, and Munich to form the grain bill. The 15 Plato wort is balanced with 50 ibu's of Bravo, Willamette, and Citra hops. All this makes for a clean hoppy IPA.

data.name: IPA
data.description: The Nickelpoint India Pale Ale is a moderately hopped IPA with an aroma of sweet citrus with pine notes at the end. Brewed with 4 varieties of hops, the smooth, medium bodied mouth-feel creates a beer very much reminiscent of it’s historic English roots, but with an American twist.

data.name: IPA
data.description: A bitter beer for the sweetest coast, our West Coast IPA hits major-key notes of citrus and flower, but finishes with a mellowing, hoppy flourish. Smooth and spirited at the same time? Only on the West Coast.

data.name: IPA
data.description:
High hop bitterness is a hallmark of this style and our IPA is no different. Light in color, high in hop flavor, 
you’ll love the citrusy, piney and touch of grapefruit aromas you find here.

data.name: IPA
data.description: Our Flagship IPA is a light copper colored East coast style with perfectly balanced caramel malts and wonderful bitter hop flavors. Cascade, Willamette, Warrior and Sorachi Ace hops combine with a strong malt backbone provided by Maris Otter Pale ale malt.

Diacetyl can be absent or may be perceived at very low levels. Chill and/or hop haze is allowable at cold temperatures. (English and citrus-like American hops are considered enough of a distinction justifying separate American-style IPA and English-style IPA categories or subcategories. Hops of other origins may be used for bitterness or approximating traditional American or English character. See English-style India Pale Ale

style.name: American-Style India Pale Ale
style.description: American-style India pale ales are perceived to have medium-high to intense hop bitterness, flavor and aroma with medium-high alcohol content. The style is further characterized by floral, fruity, citrus-like, piney, resinous, or sulfur-like American-variety hop character. Note that one or more of these American-variety hop characters is the perceived end, but the hop characters may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. The use of water with high mineral content results in a crisp, dry beer. This pale gold to deep copper-colored ale has a full, flowery hop aroma and may have a strong hop flavor (in addition to the perception of hop bitterness). India pale ales possess medium maltiness which contributes to a medium body. Fruity-ester flavors and aromas are moderate to very strong. Diacetyl can be absent or may be perceived at very low levels. Chill and/or hop haze is allowable at cold temperatures. (English and citrus-like American hops are considered enough of a distinction justifying separate American-style IPA and English-style IPA categories or subcategories. Hops of other origins may be used for bitterness or approximating traditional American or English character. See English-style India Pale Ale

data.name: IPA
data.description:
Traditionally made strong & highly hopped so it would keep on its long journey, from England to India during
British rule. Ours is a wonderfully bitter beer with a spicy aroma, some fruity characteristics and a lingering hop finish. A great
aperitif!

data.name: IPA
data.description: This is not your every day IPA. Exploding with tropical flavors of ripe mango and passion fruit, and aromas of citrus and apricot, this brew is a great alternative to a world full of ordinary IPA's. Who says we can't brew great IPA's in the south!
